de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.transport
Interface TransLayer

All Superinterfaces:
Component
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultTransLayer
public interface TransLayer
extends Component

The TransLayer acts as an NetMessageListener and listens for incoming NetMsgEvents passed from the NetLayer. It provides a framework for upper layers (i.e. the overlay layer or application layer) in order to send messages or respond to received messages. Further, message receivers which implements the TransMessageListener interface can be registered for a specific port. Incoming messages are dispatched either through port information or communication identifiers.

Version:
3.0, 12/03/2007
Author:
Sebastian Kaune, Konstantin Pussep

Method Detail

addTransMsgListener

void addTransMsgListener(TransMessageListener receiver,
                         short port)
Registers a TransMessageListener listening for incoming messages on a specific port

Parameters:
receiver - the given TransMessageListener
port - the port on which to listen for incoming messages

removeTransMsgListener

void removeTransMsgListener(TransMessageListener receiver,
                            short port)
Removes a TransMessageListener listening for incoming messages on a specific port

Parameters:
receiver - the receiver to be removed
port - the listening port

send

void send(Message msg,
          TransInfo receiverInfo,
          short senderPort,
          TransProtocol protocol)
Sends a message to a remote host by using the given TransInfo information of the receiver. Further to this, it is necessary to specify the port of the sender of the given message in order to support future replies or queries iniated by the remote receiver. Lastly, the transport protocol has to be chosen such as UDP or TCP.

Parameters:
msg - the message to be send
receiverInfo - the remote receiver which should receive the given message
senderPort - the port of the sender
protocol - the used transport protocol

sendAndWait

int sendAndWait(Message msg,
                TransInfo receiverInfo,
                short senderPort,
                TransProtocol protocol,
                TransMessageCallback senderCallback,
                long timeout)
This method is used to implement a request-reply scenario. It sends the given message to a remote host by using the given TransInfo information of the receiver and calls the given TransMessageCallback when a reply for the given message is received by using TransMessageCallback.receive(Message, TransInfo, int) method. In particular, the sendAndWait method returns a unique communication identifier which can be used to identify the above mentioned reply when implementing the TransMessageCallback interface. In addition to this, a timeout event occurs at the TransMessageCallback after timeout simulation units. Note that the timeout interval must be adapted to the time units of the simulation framework. For instance, a real time time of two milliseconds is speficied by 2 * Simulator.MILLISECOND_UNIT;

Parameters:
msg - the message to be send
receiverInfo - the remote receiver which should receive the given message
senderPort - the port of the sender
protocol - the used transport protocol
senderCallback - the TransMessageCallback which is called when receiving a reply to the given message
timeout - the timeout interval which has to be adapted to the time units of the simulation framework
Returns:
the unique communication identifier

sendReply

void sendReply(Message msg,
               TransMsgEvent receivingEvent,
               short senderPort,
               TransProtocol protocol)
Sends a reply to a specific message which has been received within a TransMsgEvent. It is recommended to use this method in order to implement a request-reply scenario.

Parameters:
msg - the given reply message
receivingEvent - the message receive event passed from the TransLayer that triggers indirectly the sending of the given reply message
senderPort - the port of the sender
protocol - the used transport protocol

getLocalTransInfo

TransInfo getLocalTransInfo(short port)
Returns the local transport information which comprises the network identifier of the connected NetLayer and the given port

Parameters:
port - the local port
Returns:
the TransInfo which comprises the network identifier of the connected NetLayer and the given port
